net.sf.mmm.transaction.api

Interface TransactionAdapter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTransactionExecutor.AbstractTransactionAdapter, JpaTransactionExecutor.JpaTransactionAdapter, JtaTransactionExecutor.JtaTransactionAdapter, NoTransactionExecutor.NoTransactionAdapter, SpringTransactionExecutor.SpringTransactionAdapter

    public interface TransactionAdapter
    This interface adapts underlying transactions.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    TransactionCallable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commit()
      This method commits the current transaction without opening a new transaction.
      TransactionContext getContext()
      This method gets the TransactionContext that allows to add individual data to be associated with this TransactionAdapter.
      void interCommit()
      This method commits the transaction currently active and opens a new one.
      boolean isActive()
      This method determines if this context holds an active transaction.
      void rollback()
      This method performs a rollback of the current transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • interCommit

        void interCommit()
        This method commits the transaction currently active and opens a new one. You should use this method for (recoverable) batches that process large sets of data and therefore would overload if everything was done in one technical transaction.

      • commit

        void commit()
        This method commits the current transaction without opening a new transaction. It allows to throw an exception in your callable but end with a commit rather than a rollback().
        ATTENTION:
        Please only use this method as end-user if there is no other way to solve your problem.

      • rollback

        void rollback()
        This method performs a rollback of the current transaction. It allows to return from your callable without committing and or throwing an exception.
        ATTENTION:
        Please only use this method as end-user if there is no other way to solve your problem.

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        This method determines if this context holds an active transaction.
        This is the case until commit() or rollback() was called explicitly.
        Returns:
        true if there is an active transaction or false otherwise.

      • getContext

        TransactionContext getContext()
        This method gets the TransactionContext that allows to add individual data to be associated with this TransactionAdapter.
        Returns:
        the TransactionContext.
